p: The duration of pre-reproductive period ( d) R. padi fell in the range from 9.5 to 11.1 days for the first generation, from 9.0 to 10.2 days for the second generation, and from 8.9 to 9.8 days for the third generation (Table 1). Higher doses of PDSs (18 g kg −1) resulted in a significant lengthening of the pre-production period in first-generation females; however, no such relationships were noted in the remaining generation of the pest. Both doses of diesel fuel used, as well as a dose of engine oil amounting to 18 g kg −1, completely inhibited the process of giving birth to larvae in the third-generation females.
